topic.title: HP Helion Openstack 1.1: Monitor File Ownership

body.p: The Icinga service, which runs in the undercloud, helps cloud admins monitor the correct ownership of ring files stored at /etc/swift.

ul.li: HP Helion Openstack cloud is successfully deployed. (Starter Object Storage (Swift) nodes are functional by default as they are part of cloud deployment)
The Icinga service is active and running in the undercloud

section.title: Monitoring the File Ownership of Object Storage (Swift)
section.p: The /etc/swift/ has Swift user permission and the files inside the /etc/swift/ has root permission. So, the Swift user has read permission on the files present inside the /etc/swift/. The script verifies the /etc/swift/ -parent folder for swift:swift ownership.
Perform the following steps to monitor the file ownership of Swift disk:

li.p: In the undercloud Horizon dashboard, log in to the Icinga Dashboard (http://<Undercloud_IP>/icinga/). The default login credentials are as follows:

Click Status on the left panel and then click
Host Detail
.

In the Host column, click the icon next to the host IP when the tooltip displays as "View Service Details For This Host". The page navigates to Service Status Details For Host <Swift node IP address > and displays the file ownership details of the selected Swift node.

row.entry: File ownership check completed. Files are with Swift monitoring.
Check for the ownership of etc/swift folder.
